meanings.sent1: She enjoys guiling her friends with surprise parties.
meanings.sent2: He was guiling his little sister by hiding her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The magician was guiling the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist was guiling innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The fox was guiling the rabbit into thinking it was safe to come out of its burrow.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone
meanings.sent1: Her guiling of her classmates led to trust issues.
meanings.sent2: The guiling in the movie plot kept the audience on edge.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's guiling of his friends always ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The guiling in the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The spy's guiling of the enemy agents helped gather valuable information.

meanings.definition: Having a deceptive or misleading appearance
meanings.sent1: The guiling mask concealed his true identity.
meanings.sent2: The guiling painting seemed to follow you with its eyes.
meanings.sent3: The guiling advertisement promised more than it delivered.
meanings.sent4: Her guiling smile hid her true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The guiling forest path led travelers astray.
